p: All parts of M. oleifera (leaves and roots, seeds, bark, fruits, flowers, and immature pods) act as cardiac and circulatory stimulants. In addition, they have antitumor, antiulcer, antispasmodic, anti-inflammatory, and antidiabetic effects, helping to maintain normal blood sugar levels as they have a high content of ascorbic acid that aids in insulin secretion) [ 74].
